hi_concept.name: State of being or existence
Conditions
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the circumstances or factors affecting the way in which state of being happens.

hi_concept.name: Position
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the status of an entity in relation to its surroundings, context, or circumstances.

hi_concept.name: Time
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the specific points or durations in which an entity exists or events occur.

hi_concept.name: Characteristics and qualities
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the inherent attributes, traits, or properties of an entity, focusing on its qualitative aspects.

hi_concept.name: Value
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the measurable quantity or amount attributed to an entity or state.

hi_concept.name: Possession
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the state of having or owning something.

hi_concept.name: Psychological (mental) state
hi_concept.definition: Expressing a person's state, attitude, and emotions.

hi_concept.name: Attitude
hi_concept.definition: Refers to a long-lasting, consistent perspective or feeling toward something, influencing behavior and shaped by experience and beliefs.

hi_concept.name: Emotions
hi_concept.definition: Refer to intense, short-term psychological states triggered by specific events, involving feelings, physiological reactions, and behaviors.
Refers to the state of being, the conditions, qualities, possession, results, or psychological states.

hi_concept.name: Processes
Physical
Motion
Self-Motion
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the movement driven by the entity itself.

hi_concept.name: Pure motion
hi_concept.definition: Refers to physical movement itself, without necessarily implying a specific goal or outcome beyond the act of moving.

hi_concept.name: Sporting
hi_concept.definition: Refers to various activities, techniques, and disciplines related to sports.

hi_concept.name: Movement Style
hi_concept.definition: Refers to a characteristic way or manner of moving, often reflecting the technique, rhythm, or pattern of motion.

hi_concept.name: Changing_location
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the activity or process of moving from one place to another.

hi_concept.name: To a Location
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the activity or process of moving to a location.

hi_concept.name: From-To
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the activity or process of moving from one place to another.

hi_concept.name: Path
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the activity or process of moving through a path.

hi_concept.name: Obstacle
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the activity or process of moving from one place to another via an obstacle.

hi_concept.name: Motion_Gesture
hi_concept.definition: Refers to a movement of part of the body or Instrument.

hi_concept.name: Manner of motion
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the way in which a movement is done.

hi_concept.name: Motion_Place
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the movement done at a place.

hi_concept.name: Transport
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the movement driven by external factors.

hi_concept.name: Relocation
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the act of moving from one place to another.

hi_concept.name: Placement
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the action of positioning or situating within a given space.
Refers to changing position or place, typically involving physical movement. It can occur through self-propulsion (self motion) or external forces (transport).

hi_concept.name: Acoustic
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the impact of one object against another with production of a sound.

hi_concept.name: Manipulative
hi_concept.definition: Refer to physically handling or interacting with objects to achieve specific outcomes.

hi_concept.name: Operational
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the execution, management, or functioning of processes, tasks, or systems to achieve specific outcomes or objectives.

hi_concept.name: Production
hi_concept.definition: Refers to methods and steps used to create or generate a product, service, or result from inputs.

hi_concept.name: Creative
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the activities and actions that lead to the generation of new ideas, concepts, art, or products.

hi_concept.name: Transformative
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the transformation of materials (like ingredients) into different states or forms.
Refers to actions or behaviors that predominantly involve bodily movement and physical exertion.

hi_concept.name: Mental
hi_concept.definition: Refer predominantly to cognitive processes and mental exertion.

hi_concept.name: Financial
hi_concept.definition: Refers to financial matters.

hi_concept.name: Judging and Evaluating
hi_concept.definition: Refers to opinions, conclusions, or evaluations.

hi_concept.name: Knowledge acquisition
hi_concept.definition: Refer to acquire, assimilate, or integrate knowledge.

hi_concept.name: Communication
hi_concept.definition: Refers to imparting or exchanging of information by speaking.

hi_concept.name: Transfer message
hi_concept.definition: Refers to conveying information or a message from one person to another.

hi_concept.name: Discussion
hi_concept.definition: Refers to an exchange of ideas, thoughts, or opinions between two or more people.

hi_concept.name: Request (question)
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the act of asking for something or seeking information from someone.

hi_concept.name: Communicated relation
hi_concept.definition: Refers to using verbal skills to be connected with someone via a specific relation.

hi_concept.name: Manner of speaking
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the way in which a Speaker speaks.

hi_concept.name: Engagement
hi_concept.definition: Refers to being involved or actively participating in a particular task, activity, or subject matter, requiring mental focus and effort.

hi_concept.name: Thinking, Intention and Planning
hi_concept.definition: Refers to effective goal-setting, problem-solving, and decision-making.

hi_concept.name: Motivational Objectives
hi_concept.definition: Refer to the set of targets, desires, and aspirations that drive an individual's actions and decisions.

hi_concept.name: Cognitive selection
hi_concept.definition: Refers to various mental processes related to choosing, prioritizing, or filtering information.

hi_concept.name: Achievement
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the successful completion or performance of tasks, actions, or activities that involve physical effort, skill, or endurance.

hi_concept.name: Phase of Action
Start
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the initiation point of the phase, marked by specific triggers or tasks.

hi_concept.name: End
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the conclusion point of the phase, marked by the completion of objectives and tasks.

hi_concept.name: Duration
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the total time span from the start to the end of the phase, reflecting the length of the phase or action.
Refers to a distinct stage within a broader process or activity.

hi_concept.name: Change
hi_concept.definition: Refers to an act or process through which somebody or something becomes different.

hi_concept.name: Change of oneself
hi_concept.definition: Refers to an act or process through which oneself becomes different.

hi_concept.name: Change of other entity
hi_concept.definition: Refers to an act or process through which someone else becomes different.

hi_concept.name: Administrative Processes
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the activities related to the management and organization of an entity.

hi_concept.name: Change of value
hi_concept.definition: Refers to any change in the value of the given entity.

hi_concept.name: Change of possesion
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the transfer of control and ownership of a property or asset from one party to another.

hi_concept.name: Gained
hi_concept.definition: Refers to a gained possession.

hi_concept.name: Lost
hi_concept.definition: Refers to a loss of possession.

hi_concept.name: Social interaction
hi_concept.definition: Expressing reciprocal influence exercised by individuals over one another during social encounters.

hi_concept.name: Positive social Interactions
hi_concept.definition: The state or condition of being related or the manner in which things are related.

hi_concept.name: Category
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the relation according to some quality or qualities in common.

hi_concept.name: Support
hi_concept.definition: Refers to providing assistance, encouragement, or resources to enhance well-being, growth, or positive outcomes in social interactions or relationships..

hi_concept.name: Collaboration
hi_concept.definition: Refers to working together with others to achieve a shared goal.

hi_concept.name: Permission
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the authorization or consent granted to do something that would otherwise be restricted or prohibited.

hi_concept.name: Comparison
hi_concept.definition: Refers to identifying similarities and differences.

hi_concept.name: Negative social interactions
hi_concept.definition: Refers to a struggle or clash between opposing forces, ideas, or interests

hi_concept.name: Competitive or confrontational interactions
hi_concept.definition: Refer to competition or conflict where individuals or groups strive to outperform each other or assert dominance.

hi_concept.name: Social Etiquette
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the expected manners and behaviors in social settings, guiding respectful and appropriate interaction.

hi_concept.name: Influence
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the capacity to affect the thoughts, behaviors, or decisions of others through various means, such as persuasion or example.

hi_concept.name: Body
hi_concept.definition: Involving the physical substance of the human organism.

hi_concept.name: Ingesting
hi_concept.definition: The act or process of taking in something for or as if for digestion

hi_concept.name: Bodily Care
hi_concept.definition: Refers to any practice that works to look after the body.

hi_concept.name: Involving body
hi_concept.definition: Refers to a physical material body.

hi_concept.name: Perception
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the act of perceiving or the ability to perceive.

hi_concept.name: Senses
hi_concept.definition: Refers to perceiving the world through our sensory organs, sensory experiences.

hi_concept.name: Visual
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the perception through eyes (sight).

hi_concept.name: Auditory
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the perception through ears (hearing).

hi_concept.name: Olfactory
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the perception through nose (smell).

hi_concept.name: Gustatory
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the perception through thongue (Taste).

hi_concept.name: Tactile
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the perception through physical contact (touch).

hi_concept.name: Weather
hi_concept.definition: Refers to dynamic changes and actions occurring in the atmosphere.

hi_concept.name: Behavioral
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the patterns, sequences, or changes in an individual's behavior over time, reflecting how they act, react, adapt, or change in various situations.
Refers to series of actions or steps taken to achieve a particular goal or outcome.

hi_concept.name: Modality
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the speaker's attitude towards an action or event.

hi_concept.name: Possibility
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the likelihood or possibility of something happening.

hi_concept.name: Necessity
hi_concept.definition: Refers to obligation or necessity.

hi_concept.name: Intention (Will)
hi_concept.definition: Refers to the intention, plan, or purpose.
